## 판결문 요약


923 A.2d 1099 (2007)
CHANCEFORD AVIATION PROPERTIES, L.L.P. and Chanceford Aviation, Inc., Appellants,
v.
CHANCEFORD TOWNSHIP BOARD OF SUPERVISORS, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued December 7, 2005.
Decided May 31, 2007.
*1101 Stacey R. MacNeal, Esq., Michael Walter Flannelly, Esq., York, for Chanceford Aviation Properties, L.L.P and Chanceford Aviation.
Timothy J. Bupp, Esq., for Chanceford Township Board of Supervisors.
BEFORE: CAPPY, C.J., and CASTILLE, NEWMAN, SAYLOR, EAKIN and BAER, JJ.

OPINION
Justice EAKIN.
Appellants, Chanceford Aviation Properties, LLP and Chanceford Aviation, Inc., own five acres of land in Chanceford Township, York County, upon which a public airport[1] is situated. Appellants are successors in interest to the property's former owner, Loretta Baublitz. Baublitz brought a mandamus action asking the trial court to enter judgment against the Chanceford Township Board of Supervisors, directing the Township to enact a zoning ordinance in compliance with the Airport Zoning Act (AZA), 74 Pa.C.S. § 5911 et seq. The parties filed crossmotions for summary judgment; the trial court granted Baublitz's motion and directed the Township to enact such an ordinance. The Commonwealth Court reversed the trial court's order. For the following reasons, we reverse the Commonwealth Court.
